perturbation.original_text: FCC will throughout the Term maintain adequate manufacturing capacity and staffing to manufacture the Terpene Product pursuant to the terms hereof at the Facility.
perturbation.changed_text: FCC will endeavor to maintain manufacturing capacity and staffing to manufacture the Terpene Product pursuant to the terms hereof at the Facility.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires FCC to 'maintain adequate manufacturing capacity,' which is a clear obligation. Changing it to 'endeavor to maintain' weakens the obligation, making it unclear what level of capacity FCC is actually required to maintain. This creates ambiguity and makes enforcement difficult.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clear and definite obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Each party hereto agrees to comply with all applicable federal, state provincial and or local environmental law, ordinances, codes, rules, regulations and permits and to handle all raw materials, off specification product, excess or scrap materials, waste, and finished products in an environmentally safe manner so as to prevent any contamination of the structure, soil or ground water in, on, or adjacent to its premises.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party hereto agrees to make reasonable efforts to comply with applicable federal, state provincial and or local environmental law, ordinances, codes, rules, regulations and permits and to handle all raw materials, off specification product, excess or scrap materials, waste, and finished products in a manner they deem reasonably safe so as to minimize contamination of the structure, soil or ground water in, on, or adjacent to its premises.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates compliance with environmental laws and safe handling of materials to prevent contamination. The modified text uses 'make reasonable efforts,' weakening the requirement and making it discretionary. The change from 'environmentally safe manner' to 'manner they deem reasonably safe' makes it subjective, and the change from 'prevent' to 'minimize' contamination introduces further ambiguity about the acceptable level of contamination. This contradicts strict liability provisions of environmental laws like CERCLA and the Clean Water Act, which often require more than just 'reasonable efforts' to comply.
perturbation.contradicted_law: CERCLA (Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act), Clean Water Act, Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA).

perturbation.original_text: FCC warrants to Flotek that: (a) all of the Terpene Product supplied by FCC to Flotek shall: (i) conform to the specifications set forth in Section 1; 3 (ii) comply with all relevant laws and regulations including, without limitation, laws and regulations of each of the jurisdictions in which the Terpene Product are either manufactured or to be sold or used concerning purity, sanitation, safety, security, and packaging and labeling of food and beverage; (iii) be in good condition at the time of delivery in all respects; and (iv) be free from any defect in design, workmanship, materials and packaging
perturbation.changed_text: FCC represents to Flotek that: (a) all of the Terpene Product supplied by FCC to Flotek will aim to: (i) generally conform to the specifications set forth in Section 1; 3 (ii) generally comply with all relevant laws and regulations; (iii) be in acceptable condition at the time of delivery in most respects; and (iv) be generally free from any significant defect in design, workmanship, materials and packaging
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'warrants' with 'represents' weakens the guarantee. Adding 'aim to' makes the obligations aspirational rather than mandatory. 'Generally conform,' 'generally comply,' 'acceptable condition in most respects,' and 'generally free from any significant defect' are all highly subjective and ambiguous, undermining the clear requirements of the original text. This could conflict with consumer protection laws and warranty laws, as the diluted language provides very little actual assurance of product quality or compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) implied and express warranty provisions; Consumer protection laws.
